head.title: Coronavirus (COVID-19) Information - Zion Elementary School District 6

input.name: __VIEWSTATE

a.title: Go to Zion Elementary School District 6
Go to Zion Central Middle School

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

br.span:
This portal is designed to provide District 6 parents, students, and staff, with information regarding the Coronavirus (COVID-19). We will update this page regularly as new information becomes available from the Center for Disease Control (CDC), Illinois Department of Public Health (IDPH), and the Lake County Health Department.
Remote Learning Center
Our portal for student remote learning resources.

Below are the communications that have been sent to District 6 families. We will continue to add any additional communications relating to the Coronavirus (COVID-19).
Message From Dr. Roberts
March 31, 2020 - District 6 School Closure Extensions
March 31, 2020 - New Remote Learning Resources Available
March 20, 2020 - School Closure Update
March 16, 2020 - District 6 School Closure Update
As mandated by Governor Pritzker, all schools will remain closed through March 30th. Zion District 6 will tentatively reopen Tuesday, April 7th. If it is anticipated that schools will remain closed beyond March 30th, further details will be provided as they become available.

strong.span: Grab & Go Meal Meal Distribution Program

span.span: District 6 offers students the opportunity to receive refrigerated and or reheatable breakfast and lunch meals; provided through a District 6 grant funded program.Meals available for pick-up Monday-Friday 9am - 12:00pm during school closures, every Monday through Friday, through April 30th or until school resumes for students.. The first day of our Grab and Go program was a success. Check it out
Zion Central Middle School, 1716 27th Street (9:00 am - 12:00 noon)

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

br.span:
Do you have questions? The Illinois Department of Public Health (IDPH) has established a COVID-19 hotline and email address to answer questions from the public.
(800) 889-3931

span.style: letter-spacing: 0.3px; font-size: 14px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

hr.span: Find the latest updates for Lake County

strong.style: font-size: 14px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Tahoma; letter-spacing: 0.3px;

span.style: letter-spacing: 0.3px; font-size: 14px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

br.span: To help avoid the spread of Coronavirus (COVID-19), our cleaning service, GSF-USA, has instructed their staff to increase the disinfection of touch points while also making disinfection a multi-step process. They have provided the following handout for more information.

hr.span:
Continue to practice effective hand washing techniques
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands
Avoid close contact with people who are sick
Stay home at the first sign of any symptoms of illness
Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces
COVID-19 and Mental Health
While much of our current focus is on how to best protect the physical health of ourselves and others, it is equally important that we talk about and take proper steps to ensure we maintain our mental health, and the mental health of our children.
Talk to your child about COVID-19. Answer questions and share facts in a way they can understand.
Reassure your child that they are safe, and comfort them when needed.
Share how you deal with stress so that they can learn how to cope with you.
Limit your family's exposure to news coverage of the event.
Keep a regular routine. Take breaks, rest, exercise, and eat well.

span.style: text-align: left; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; text-decoration: none; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; float: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); display: inline !important; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span:
It is important that parents are in-tune with their children during these unprecedented times. See the resources below for additional information.
